entry.title: Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (2)20131210
I played today for an hour. I did the Championship of the Novice
level. My first try I did 2nd, 1st, 2nd. In the second race, I
noticed that I wasn't in the right view (cockpit)... I wonder why
it changed? I got some Hard Sports wheels for my Focus and tried
again: did 1st, 6th (problem reversing), 1st. I also realized that
it had forgotten my driving preferences. That's lame that I have
to keep adjusting it.

Next, I did the first B license test. I got a Silver on my second
try and then worked on a Gold. It didn't take long and I ended up
with this score:

National B License Test: B-1 0:32.919

I decided to record my first screen of states as I go:

Novice - 3% - 3 - 24 - 8 - 14 - 8 - $54.8k

Total time: 2:09
  • Video Games
  • Gran Turismo 6
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013)
entry.content:
Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013)20131209
I finally got this game today. (It had been delayed in the mail.)
It was fun to set up my Wheelstand Pro and G27. I played a few
races... four or five I think. I bought the Fit, because you have
to, and used it for the first set. Then I bought a Focus ST and
did the next track. I've decided to do the whole game without any
assists, which is very exciting. I'm enjoying the game a ton
already. I've also decided to avoid using the million credits I
got from the pre-order until the twilight of the game.

Novice - 1% - 0 - 15 - 7 - 8 - 5 - $30k

Total time: 1:14
  • Video Games
  • Gran Turismo 6
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 3 - Harmony of the Worlds
entry.content:
Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 3 - Harmony of the Worlds20131209
I found this to be a less interesting episode because it was so
focused on the relatively small story of astronomy. I felt like
the history was less important than the outcomes. It was
okay though.

entry.title: Game: Battletoads & Double Dragon (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Battletoads & Double Dragon (SNES, 1993)20131208
I played this for about five minutes and beat the first stage and
got to Adobo. The game feels really stiff. The stun-lock that you
can get is really aggravating. It feels like it was designed to
have really long animations that look cool, rather than actually
play well.

Total time: 0:05
  • Video Games
  • Battletoads & Double Dragon
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu (SNES, 1993)20131208
Something about this game was causing my setup to blank out
repeatedly. It was very annoying and I couldn't take it, so I
turned it off. I managed to get through the first level and it
seemed a lot like the first game, but when I got to the World Map,
it seemed nice to have a clearer path.

Total time: 0:03

  • Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu

entry.title: Game: Ken Griffy Major League Baseball (SNES, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Ken Griffy Major League Baseball (SNES, 1994)20131208
I played a few innings of this and couldn't get into it. I found
the controls to be surprisingly good but I didn't feel like you
did much. I think it would be better with more indicators like Hot
Shots Golf and maybe something like button mashing for
running... stuff like that... to make you feel more in it.

Total time: 0:05
  • Video Games
  • Ken Griffy Major League Baseball
  • SNES
  • 1994

entry.content:

entry.title: Game: Super Bomberman 2 (SNES, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Super Bomberman 2 (SNES, 1994)20131208
I did a very poor job at this tonight. I played the first level
and died immediately on the second level. As I said with the last
one, I feel like these are very fun games, but they're very hard
to appreciate on the couch or for long periods of time. Even on a
DS, I can imagine it being a pain to play because you'd have to
switch in and out of it. I really want games like this part of a
larger game system that switches between games every few levels.

Total time: 0:04
  • Video Games
  • Super Bomberman 2
  • SNES
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: Super Star Wars: Return of the Jedi (SNES, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Super Star Wars: Return of the Jedi (SNES, 1994)20131208
This one was not much different than the others. The Speeder stage
was bizarre and I barely made it. Then there was a side-scrolling
level that felt exactly like the side-scrolling level from the
previous game's opening stage but with different textures. Weird.

Total time: 0:06

entry.title: Game: Tetris Battle Gaiden (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Tetris Battle Gaiden (SNES, 1993)20131208
I played this for about fifteen minutes. It felt like a good
rendition of Tetris. I found the AI really hard and it really
painful to play Tetris well while fighting the opponent. My first
match against Halloween I didn't know how to launch attacks. I
think I will put this in my stack of good "Vs" games.

Later my kids had a try at playing it and thought it was very fun.

Total time: 0:15
  • Video Games
  • Tetris Battle Gaiden
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Torneko's Great Adventure: Mysterious Dungeon (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Torneko's Great Adventure: Mysterious Dungeon (SNES, 1993)20131208
I played this for about twenty minutes. I got the Jewel Chest from
the Trial Dungeon and was on my way out at Level 5 when I was
killed by a Mummy. It stunk. This is very similar to Shiren the
Wanderer. I like it.

Total time: 0:23

entry.title: Movie: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire, starring Jennifer Lawrence (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire, starring Jennifer Lawrence (2013)20131207
We saw this in the theatres. I enjoyed it a lot. I thought the
acting was great and it brought across the highs and lows of the
book. I like the epicness of the story, so it was fun to see it on
the big screen.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (US) (SNES, 1993) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (US) (SNES, 1993) (3)20131206
I played today for about fifteen minutes and went back and forth
on 3-1 and 3-2. I was soooo annoyed by the game. I kept getting
killed by dead Birdos, the Throw button wasn't working, you can't
duck under Birdo eggs or other projectiles, urgh. I was so
annoyed. I wonder if it's just the All-Stars version that is
bugging me?

Total time: 1:51
  • Video Games
  • Super Mario All-Stars: Super Mario Bros. 2 (US)
  • SNES
  • 1993
